page.title: 08ANCIENT CUSTOMS OF WYCHWOOD
page.content:
In the {Hundred Rolls,}and {Ancient {Woodlands}it is stated that the people living around the forest exercised the following {Woodland Rights}: 1. Removal of dead timber
2. Grazing of animals The latter was still taking place in { {1792 .}Cattle, horses,sheep,and pigs at specified times, and within certain boundaries were allowed into the Forest from Finstock, Leafield, Ramsden. {Palm Sunday} saw Leafield villagers going to {Wort's Well }to collect water in bottles containing Spanish Wood and peppermint. This was used as a remedy for winter ailments.
